name: B. Sereja and Mirroring
statement:
Let’s assume that we are given a matrix of size , let’s determine the
operation of mirroring matrix . The mirroring of matrix is a matrix
which has the following properties: the upper half of matrix (rows with
numbers from to ) exactly matches ; the lower half of matrix (rows with
numbers from to ) is symmetric to the upper one; the symmetry line is
the line that separates two halves (the line that goes in the middle,
between rows and ). Sereja has an matrix . He wants to find such matrix
, that it can be transformed into matrix , if we’ll perform on it
(possibly zero) mirrorings. What minimum number of rows can such matrix
contain?
editorial:
Lets solve problem from another side. We will try to cut of matix as
many times as we can. Cut means operation, reversed to operation
described in statement. To check, can we cut matrix we need to check
following conditions:1). 2). for all .
